metadata.title: CVE-2023-52732 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ceph:blocklist the kclient when receiving corrupted snap trace When receivedcorrupted snap trace we don't know what exactly has happened in MDS side.And we shouldn't continue IOs and metadatas access to MDS, which maycorrupt or get incorrect contents. This patch will just block all thefurther IO/MDS requests immediately and then evict the kclient itself. Thereason why we still need to evict the kclient just after blocking all thefurther IOs is that the MDS could revoke the caps faster.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic-64k - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-gcp - 6.5.0-1010.10~22.04.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-14.14.1~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia - 6.5.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia-64k - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1013-oracle - 6.5.0-1013.13~22.04.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1003-oem - 6.5.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-starfive - 6.5.0-1007.8~22.04.1
No subscription required
